        public readonly bool Equals(DapperDecimalVo other)

            // It's possible to create uninitialized instances via converters such as EfCore (HasDefaultValue), which call Equals.

            if(!_isInitialized || !other._isInitialized) return false;

            return System.Collections.Generic.EqualityComparer<decimal>.Default.Equals(Value, other.Value);

        public readonly bool Equals(decimal primitive) => Value.Equals(primitive);

        public readonly override bool Equals(object obj)
        {
            return obj is DapperDecimalVo && Equals((DapperDecimalVo) obj);

        public static bool operator ==(DapperDecimalVo left, DapperDecimalVo right) => Equals(left, right);
        public static bool operator !=(DapperDecimalVo left, DapperDecimalVo right) => !(left == right);

        public static bool operator ==(DapperDecimalVo left, decimal right) => Equals(left.Value, right);
        public static bool operator !=(DapperDecimalVo left, decimal right) => !Equals(left.Value, right);

        public static bool operator ==(decimal left, DapperDecimalVo right) => Equals(left, right.Value);
        public static bool operator !=(decimal left, DapperDecimalVo right) => !Equals(left, right.Value);

            public override void SetValue(System.Data.IDbDataParameter parameter, DapperDecimalVo value)
            {
                parameter.DbType = System.Data.DbType.Decimal;

            public override DapperDecimalVo Parse(object value)
            {
                return value switch
